title: Controlling Saturation to Improve Per- and Polyfluoroalkyl Substance (PFAS) Removal in Biochar-Amended Stormwater Bioretention Systems
content:
Environ. Sci.: Water Res. Technol., 2024, Accepted Manuscript
DOI: 10.1039/D3EW00767G, Paper

Kathleen Mills Hawkins, James Conrad Pritchard, Scott Struck, Yeo-Myoung Cho, Richard G. Luthy, Christopher Higgins
Black carbon-amended bioretention systems are an increasingly popular strategy for the removal of organic contaminants, including poly- and perfluoroalkyl substances (PFASs) and other trace organic contaminants (TOrCs), from urban stormwater....
